dataset.title: Ground Water Level at Brownsville and Hog Island, VA 1997-2009

metadataProvider.organizationName: Virginia Coast Reserve Long-Term Ecological Research Project

address.deliveryPoint: Department of Environmental Sciences, University of Virginia, 291 McCormick Road, PO Box 400123

abstract.para: Water levels were measured on Phillips Creek Marsh from October 1997 through December 2009 and on Hog Island from November 2002 through August 2007. Data collection for some of the stations are included in follow-on VCRLTER datasets: "knb-lter-vcr-207- Ground Water Levels at Phillips Creek Marsh, VA 2012-present" and "knb-lter-vcr.177-Groundwater Levels on Hog Island, VA. 2007-"

Water levels were recorded at 3 wells in the Phillips Creek Marsh at Brownsville Plantation near Nassawadox, VA. One was located near the creek bank, one in the mid-marsh and one in the high marsh. On Hog Island, four loggers were located at the edge of the marsh, in the adjacent shrub thicket, near a freshwater pond in the center of the island and in an adjacent thicket (running from the bay towards the ocean side of the island).

Water levels were recorded in wells using WL40 level loggers. The WL40 units have a sealed data logger attached to a conductive wire that runs along a plastic pole. When inserted into a well, the logger records the amount of the wire that is submersed, based on capacitance. The advantage of this method is that it is insensitive to atmospheric pressure changes or to changes in water salinity. Data is dumped via an optical interface to a calculator.

listitem.para: Manual for dumping water level recorders) URL=http://www.vcrlter.virginia.edu/monitoring/watlev.html
Manufacturers manual for WL40 logger) URL=http://www.rdsys.com/WL Series Product Manual.pdf
Location map of wells on Hog Island) URL=http://www.vcrlter.virginia.edu/monitoring/t1watlev.gif

The UVA grants you (hereafter, Licensee) a license to use the data and documentation for academic, and research purposes only, without a fee.

listitem.para: notify the VCR/LTER designated contact (typically the investigator who collected the data) regarding its distribution of the derivative work, and
clearly notify users that such derivative work is a modified version and not the original data and documentation distributed by the UVA.
acknowledge the support of NSF Grants BSR-8702333-06, DEB-9211772, DEB-9411974, DEB-0080381 and DEB-0621014 in any publications using the data and documentation.
send to the address, above, two reprints of any publications resulting from use of the data and documentation.

section.para: Any Licensee wishing to make commercial use of the data and documentation should contact the UVA, c/o VCR/LTER, to negotiate an appropriate license for such commercial use. Commercial use includes

listitem.para: integration of all or part of the data and documentation into a product for sale or license by or on behalf of Licensee to third parties, or
distribution of the data or documentation to third parties that need it to utilize a commercial product sold or licensed by or on behalf of Licensee.

description.para: For data from 1997-1999 data were tabluated into spreadsheets and subsequently integrated using a SAS program. For data subsequent to 2003, data were collected and processed directly by a SAS program. A copy of the program is listed below:

dataTable.entityDescription: Ground Water Level at Brownsville and Hog Island, VA 1997-2009

description.para: Location name. Where no location name is available, the serial number of the water level recorder is used.

attribute.attributeDefinition: TIME - Time of day (Eastern Standard Time)

attribute.attributeLabel: Elevation of water surface above mean sea level
attribute.attributeDefinition: ELEVMSL - Elevation of water surface above mean sea level

description.para: Where elevation above MSL (based on GPS measurements relative to the NAVD88 datum) was available, the raw level was transformed to elevation relative to MSL. For stations without recorded elevations, the raw levelin in inches was converted to meters with no other transformations.
The formulas used for specific stations were:

attribute.attributeDefinition: ELEVSUR - Elevation relative to ground surface

description.para: For sites where elevation of the well head above the ground surface was available, the raw level measurement was converted to water level relative to the ground surface. For sites where this measurement was not available this variable contains the raw level converted to meters. Conversions used were:

attribute.attributeLabel: Water level in inches (not relative to any datum)
attribute.attributeDefinition: LEVELIN - Water level in inches (not relative to any datum)

attribute.attributeLabel: Date and time data was dumped from logger
attribute.attributeDefinition: ADD_DATE - Date and time data was dumped from logger

textDomain.definition: Date and time data was dumped from logger
